attributes.action: Widen parking bays by amending the out of date Government Parking Standards.
attributes.additional_details:
The classic 1959 Ford Anglia was just 1.42m wide. This is quite a lot narrower than a modern Ford Fiesta which comes in at a portly 1.72m.

Even the latest Ford Mondeo is 4 cm longer than the average parking space.

A recent report by Accident Exchange said scratches and bumps, in car parks have increased by 35% since 2014.  Such incidents now account for around 30% of all accidents recorded in the UK. 

https://www.confused.com/on-the-road/safety/high-suv-demand-small-parking-spaces
attributes.background:
Government parking standards recommended minimum sizes are 2.4m wide and 4.8m long.

http://www.planningni.gov.uk/downloads/parking-standards.pdf

It is about time the recommended width was increased to at least 2.8m.  The Vauxhall Corsa – is 16% larger than it was 15 yrs ago.
